timeline.bodyText: I personally don't like these numbers (19), (18), (4), somewhat pointless yet increase maintenance work, WDYT? @wu-sheng
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: I am OK in either way. No prefer. Maintaining this is good for rebalancing only.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
I am OK in either way. No prefer. Maintaining this is good for rebalancing only.

We don't and can't rebalance them now, all plugin tests run in parallel, saying "rebalance" makes no sense at all
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText:
I don't feel much objective about this word rebalance. From my understanding, rebalancing could target time or number of group elements. For time, yes, they are parallel, but if one fails, the number of group elements matters when we re-run.
Basically you could consider my point as no harm at least.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: For rerunning failed tests, make sense to me now, didn’t thought about this
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: OK. Since the concerns have be resolved, merging.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
I agree with it is hard to maintain the number of versions. And now, I still cannot sure they are correct in all.
Make every group have the same number of versions as far as possible. It is necessary. If not, we don't need to split them into multi groups. At least, the adjustment is harmless.
replies.author: dmsolr
